bio:treatment.description: Roadsides, moist thickets, waste places, edges of woods;
introduced; Man., N.B., N.S., Ont., P.E.I., Que.; Calif., Conn., Del., Ill., Ind., Maine, Md., Mass., Mich., Mo., N.H., N.J., N.Y., Ohio, Pa., R.I., Vt., Va., W.Va., Wis.
bio:treatment.discussion: Humulus lupulus var. lupulus is indigenous to Europe. It has become established by introduction for ornament and for flavoring beer. Although not yet collected in all parts of the range, it should be expected, particularly as pistillate clones around abandoned homesteads. Humulus lupulus var. lupulusis reported from Oregon but no precise locality is known.
